item.description:
Helping William Walk Benefit Concert

Sunday March 4th 2012 at 2PM - Stockbrideg Theater in Derry NH
WITH SPECIAL GUEST: Karen Grenier (www.kgrenier.com) to open the show William is a medically fragile 8 year old child diagnosed with Mitochondrial complex I and III deficiencies, failure to thrive, cerebral folate deficiency, epilepsy, dyspraxia, spastic diplegia, dysphagia, and acid reflux…just to name a few. Even though he can eat by mouth, he hardly feels hunger, so he is also fed by a feeding tube and takes over twenty doses of medicine a day. Because of William’s complicated medical issues, his walking has gotten worse and is very unsteady. He walks on his toes most of the time and by the end of the day he is crawling around the house. Innovative Neurotronics has come up with The Pediatric Walkaide, an electronic stimulation unit that attaches to each of William's legs and sends signals to his nerves to lift his feet when he walks. These units are $4800 each, and not covered by insurance. Jimmy and the Boys have stepped up to the plate to help raise the money for William's Walkaides! Won't you come and enjoy a great afternoon of country music and HELP WILLIAM WALK?

TICKETS ON SALE for a donation of $13.00 per ticket at the following locations:

  • Poor Boys Diner, 136 Rockingham Rd (Rt28), Londonderry NH
  • Mobil On The Run, 1019 Second St, Manchester NH
  • Pinkerton Academy at the Stockbridge Theater, 5 Pinkerton St, Derry NH (box office 603-437-5210)

****there is a $2 convenience charge if you buy through the theater box office****

If you have any questions, you may send them via email to WILLIAMWALKS@aol.com.

If you cannot attend the show and would like to donate please send check to: HELPING WILLIAM WALK PO BOX 233 Chester NH 03036
item.name: Helping William Walk Benefit Concert
